intro: Desmotrichum forcipatum, commonly known as the African sandwort, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a small, herbaceous annual that typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant features simple, alternate leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its succulent stems and adaptive traits suited to arid environments. Due to its hardy nature, it is often found in disturbed or dry habitats.
